fast.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: moving or able to move quickly
fast.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He’s one of the fastest runners in the world.
fast.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: doing something or happening in a short time
fast.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The subway is the fastest way to get downtown.
The company must give a faster response to clients’ requests.
The rain forests are being chopped down at an alarmingly fast rate.
fast.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a clock that is fast shows a later time than the real time
fast.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: That can’t be the time – my watch must be fast.
I always keep my watch 15 minutes fast.
fast.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a colour that is fast will not change when clothes are washed
fast.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a fast surface is one on which a ball moves very quickly
fast.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: becoming involved quickly in sexual relationships with men
fast.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: moving or able to move quickly
The cheetah is the fastest animal in the world.
a fast car
moving fast or doing something in a short time
He was much quicker than I was over the first 100 metres.
Do I have time for a quick shower?
high-speed
designed to travel or operate very quickly
a high-speed train
high-speed Internet access
happening in a short period of time – used about changes, increases, improvements etc
a rapid increase in the population
the rapid expansion of the firm’s business in the Middle East
a rapid decline in profits
swift
moving quickly or happening after only a short time
The horses ran along the track at a swift trot.
He received a swift response to his letter.
brisk
quick and energetic
a brisk walk in the countryside
His manner was very brisk.
speedy
happening after only a short time
Everyone wishes you a speedy recovery.
a speedy resolution to the problem
hurried
done more quickly than usual, because you do not have much time
She ate a hurried breakfast in the cafe before catching her train.
We made a hurried departure.
hasty
deciding or doing something very quickly, especially when this has bad results
It was a hasty decision, which he later regretted.
Let’s not be too hasty.
fast.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
Johnny ran off as fast as his legs could carry him  (=running as quickly as he could).
fast.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Kids grow up fast these days.
How fast can you get the job done?
It all happened so fast I didn’t even notice I was bleeding.
Access to the Internet is fast becoming a necessity.
fast.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to eat little or no food for a period of time, especially for religious reasons
fast.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a period during which someone does not eat, especially for religious reasons
fast.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Gandhi drank some orange juice to break (=end) his three-week  fast.
fast.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: The Bank of England was criticized for not cutting interest rates fast enough.
How fast can you get that report done?
fast.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: The IT industry is expanding at an incredibly fast rate.
Trading has been fast and furious (=full of excitement and activity) this afternoon.
We guarantee a fast response to all inquiries.
